Package leitej.thread

Class AgnosticThread

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.lang.Thread
      • leitej.thread.AgnosticThread
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.lang.Runnable
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    XAgnosticThread
    public class AgnosticThread
extends java.lang.Thread
    The AgnosticThread class extends Thread to achieve an agnostic and asynchronous invocation of any object's public methods.

    Code example to use:
    AgnosticThread athread = new AgnosticThread();
    athread.workOn(
      new Invoke(
        this,
        AgnosticUtil.getMethod(
          this,
          "somePublicMethod"
        )
      )
    )
    ...
    public void somePublicMethod(){};

    The AgnosticThread instances can be reused for other invocations.
    Author:
    Julio Leite
    See Also:
    Thread, ThreadData, InvokeItf

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor Description
      AgnosticThread()
      Creates a new instance of AgnosticThread, with a thread name (null) and to run invoke only once.
      AgnosticThread​(boolean keepAlive)
      Creates a new instance of AgnosticThread, with a thread name (null).
      AgnosticThread​(java.lang.String name)
      Creates a new instance of AgnosticThread, to run invoke only once.
      AgnosticThread​(java.lang.String name, boolean keepAlive)
      Creates a new instance of AgnosticThread.
      AgnosticThread​(ThreadData threadData)
      Creates a new instance of AgnosticThread, with a thread name (null) and to run invoke only once.
      AgnosticThread​(InvokeItf invoke)
      Creates a new instance of AgnosticThread, with a thread name (null) and to run invoke only once.
      This is like a fire and forget, don't need to check the return of invocation or is void.
